Pros:
1. friendly and supportive colleagues
2. dynamic and fast-paced work environment

Pros: There is always someone for something if I encounter with technical problem. Solid and smart engineer team that almost 24/7 available for me.
Cons: "Kiasu" type of working. Originally from Singapore, so the working culture is theirs.

Pros: Overall working in Xtremax has been enjoyable for me. Despite all the ups and downs, I learned so many things here. From the time I was fresh grads without experience, up to today where I am already ready to digest almost all tasks given. I think every company has good and bad, but as long as it's bearable, it's good for us.
Cons: Keep working and improving on tidying up the processes to be more transparent for employees. Then employees can practically run by themselves to achieve goals.

Pros: work balance, team work, and comportable
Cons: good for fresh graduated, and hv some benefits than othes.

Pros:
1) Steep learning curve mostly for cloud infrastructure services, network configuration and security. 
2) Good team support nevertheless can be hard sometimes
3) Good opportunity for fresh-grads to harden their confidence skills in managing the tasks
Cons:
1) 24/7 support, with rotation (so you know what to expect)
2) Lower salary and benefits in comparison to competitors
3) Work-life balance (sometimes)

Pros:

Pros: Flexible environment where I can be myself and improve many stuffs that I am facing. It's a good place to learn and have a strong learning culture. This place is very suitable for those fresh grads with fresh blood to learn.
Cons: Improve the technical framework .

Review Title: Good colleagues, good culture, but a bit insecure
Pros: Overall, it was a good experience working at Xtremax. It's just because of the recent restructuring, it gives a bit of anxiousness to the employees about our job security.
Cons: Building a more robust business to withstand change in the business climate.

Pros: Really great and supportive teammates
Cons:
- Too micromanaged and too many layers of process
- Less manpower in a team

Pros: At Xtremax, there are valuable learning opportunities available. With 99% of projects originating from the Public Sector, you'll gain a comprehensive understanding of the requirements for collaborating effectively within this domain.
Cons: Too many. Unreasonable, stingy, high turnover, messy, no overall strategy. Emotional workplace. Ran a few rounds of retrenchment.

Pros: Good company for fresh graduate
Cons: Nothing, all good working here

Pros: Generally, it's just normal to work in Xtremax. The team is helpful and friendly, there's a food in the pantry but not too many, the work is challenging but still manageable. Feels normal to me.
Cons: Keep improving the processes .

Pros: Nice colleagues and team, it's the place where everyone works together to deliver the project. Less politics among the team members. It makes the team relationship less complicated.
Cons: Better remuneration and more events to strengthen the team bonding.

Review Title: Not really that great for long term
Pros: You'd be familiar with cloud tech. Good to start your career, but not for too long. High salary standard for Bandung area (don't compare with rich startups). Great benefits such as private health insurance (XCare), 14 days annual leave (plus 1 each year after 2 years of service, max 20 or something), company events once a year, paid duo BPJS WFH depending on project situation (heard they're going fully WFO soon tho) Full of young people. Some get their cinlok and get married.
Cons: Depends on your project contract, some project will force you to finish the issue ASAP, means you'll be up all night until it's done. C level got too many free time that he micromanage all the simple things rather than finding more projects in to keep the employees busy and keep our dapur ngebul. Too many work flow changes. I'm sure veteran here will still get confused. Also heard they going to layoff more than half of their employees. Why don't they sell the office and rent smaller one just to keep the servers up then let all the employees WFH. Firing high management who doesn't make any revenue may also do rather than impacting innocent lowlings

Pros: The company culture is overall great. They emphasize a growth mindset and try to care about people. They have a strong emphasis on diversity and inclusion which helps everyone think about how to create a more welcoming and inclusive environment.
Cons: A lot of work is still hard which makes it difficult to be visible if you’re new and remote, impacting promotions, influence.

Pros: Good working environment, nice coworker, good benefits
Cons: Management is not that clear yet

Pros: Good environament, The salary received is quite large.
Cons: The CTO interferes too much in the matters below.

Pros: Xtremax is my first job and I found while many things are not so clearly defined, it's still quite bearable and okay. I value the learning curve and experience working in the project. The technology stack is also quite interesting such as cloud, containerization, and microservices. It's a good experience.
Cons: Stability in managing the team.

Pros: Xtremax is a good employer. They can give you a lot of opportunities to help your career growth!
Cons: Depending on the job and role you apply for, you might not like the company or the managers that you're placed under.

Pros: Working with these companies leads to many opportunities. Really great experience for working in the corporate world with great benefits and resources.
Cons: You most likely will have to pivot your role a lot to be able to move up.

Pros: Every group or division can be different in how they treat their employees, but I'd say overall there is a very good atmosphere of trust & value everywhere.
Cons: They don't try to make the workplace anything special

Pros: - Flexible and fully remote - Balance worklife (depending on project assigned) - Good team and everyone is friendly (not management) - Meet people from around the world (Indonesia, Singapore)
Cons: Was surprised there aren't that many negative ratings/reviews. This review represent Malaysia. Not Singapore or Indonesia office. - Low salary and the benefits are very bad - Promised quarterly performance review and annual increment but received none - No bonus - High turnover rate (from both Singapore and Malaysia, including HR, Director, Developer, so on...) - Many red flags within the company (learnt and heard from others about how management handle things) - Management pushing Malaysia employees to work in Singapore but offered minimum wage. (better off be a dish washer at Singapore) - The company only looks good on the outside. - Malaysia team feels like being left out

Pros:
Office environment is spacious

Productivity tools
Profesionalism, no politics no drama
Cons: No holiday if Indonesian government release a holiday decree (cuti bersama)

Review Title: Xtremax is used to be great place, but....
Pros:
- Competitive salary
- Fair benefits (health insurance, snacks, promotions)
- Casual environment
Cons:
- Everything is used to be great, but until the massive lay-off
- Multitasking & multitasking everywhere. People handling more than one projects at once. 
- Lacks of great senior employee. A lot of experts and senior people left the company
- Management changes so fast (policies, workflows, KPIs)

Review Title: Learn a lot, not to stay long term
Pros: great teams, technically sound people
Cons: not healthy for your own long term, try to find a different job after you learnt a lot

Pros: Very good working place, high preasue
Cons: Noting comes in mind at the moment

Pros: - Depends on the project you are in, I placed on a team that handle project related to cloud services and microservices so I learn a lot of things. - Great team leader and colleagues.

Pros: Everything is in past tense - Was a great environment to work at - Was WFH, now hybrid - Had great team members - Had periodic company celebrations/events
Cons: - Lower than market rate salaries - Huge retrenchment internationally - Management messed up big time - Slow in compensating/recognizing your work - Company morale at an all-time low

Pros: Co workers can be supportive
Cons: Unclear workflow, perfunctory management, overwork is a habit, late payment of social insurance by the company and will effect on employees who are laid off

Pros: Working at this company has been a great experience, largely due to the fantastic coworkers. The team here is incredibly supportive, collaborative, and friendly.
Cons: During my time at this company, I have felt that the boss consistently looked down on me. This has created a hostile work environment and made it difficult for me to thrive in my role. Their condescending attitude and lack of support have impacted my self-esteem and job satisfaction. It's crucial for any workplace to foster an atmosphere of respect and collaboration.

Review Title: Great Colleagues but typical family business management style
Pros: - Colleagues are fantastic - There is no talk down from the team leads or department heads - WFH culture
Cons: - CEO & CTO's directions keep changing - Management communication breakdown. Even though they are married couple, they do not communicate with each other and staffs always stuck in between or being blame for the miscommunication - CEO & CTO do not trust the staffs to make certain decision - Salary & Benefits is not competitive in the industry

Review Title: A good place for fresh graduate. Can learn a lot

Cons: Company expands too much but ignore current projects.

Pros: Overall good company, good potential for cloud computing and digital transformation. Good learning path.

Review Title: A good place to start but not for a long time
Pros: You'll have a lot of good coworkers who understand each other.
Cons: - A company that does not have a job description for each department and individual (if we can say: no clear direction). - All works can be on your plate regardless of time and must be completed quickly. - Many have gastritis and severe stress due to the amount of work that demands in a short time. - In addition, there are also some rights that employees should receive but there are internal problems that are never resolved. Finally, many were disappointed with the results.

Pros: Good place to learn but not a good place to stay
